alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Montour; Northumberland; Schuylkill; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 3:44AM EST until March 07 at 5:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches in the Susquehanna Valley with locally up to 4 or 5 inches across the higher terrain near and to the north of Interstate 80 and across portions of northern Schuylkill County. * WHERE...Union, Montour, Northumberland, Columbia and Schuylkill Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 5 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow will initially be wet with accumulations highly elevation dependent since temperatures at the onset of snow will be in the 30s to around 40 degrees.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts will include snow covered roads and limited visibility. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
